intro: Wislizenia refracta, commonly known as false hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive, flattened structure. Wislizenia refracta is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to stabilize soils and provide habitat for pollinators.
